Class aa_a_Environment

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.software.reuze.aa_a_Environment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    aa_i_Environment, aa_i_EnvironmentViewNotifier
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    a_CellWorldEnvironment, aa_EnvironmentMap, demoNQueens.NQueensEnvironment

extends Object
implements aa_i_Environment, aa_i_EnvironmentViewNotifier

    Ravi Mohan, Ciaran O'Reilly

      • createExogenousChange

        public void createExogenousChange()
        Method for implementing dynamic environments in which not all changes are directly caused by agent action execution. The default implementation does nothing.

      • step

        public void step()
        Central template method for controlling agent simulation. The concrete behavior is determined by the primitive operations getPerceptSeenBy(aa_i_Agent), executeAction(aa_i_Agent, aa_i_Action), and createExogenousChange().
        Specified by:
        step in interface aa_i_Environment

      • step

        Description copied from interface: aa_i_Environment
        Move the Environment n time steps forward.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        n - the number of time steps to move the Environment forward.
